TopicTitle: What is the absolutely first game you remember playing?

Articles.Content:
For me, it was Giana sisters, or some similar Mario like game, on Spectrum ZX at friends.

I was some 6 years old, the year was 1990.

For me, it was Giana sisters, or some similar Mario like game, on Spectrum ZX at friends.

I was some 6 years old, the year was 1990.

Well, for me it is more complicated.. the first game console EVER in my life was the Atari 2600, but I don't remember any specific games anymore..

The first computer was the Amstrad CPC6128, and here I remember "Harrier Attack", "Miami Vice", and my all time favorite on that machine: "Exolon".

And my first PC came preinstalled with stuff from my uncle, and I remember two of the games: MS Flight Simulator 4.0, and "Wolfenstein 3D" (yeah, my uncle brouht me into shooters.. AND simulations

I remember that machine like it was yesterday.. 14" CRT screen that was utter crap, 386DX40 (AMD Clone), 4Megs of Ram, 120 Megs of HDD .. and it was years until I had saved enough allowance to get an

ISA-Soundblaster and a matching CD-Rom Drive (back in those days, the CD-Rom attached to the Soundcard.. ) but hey, Rebel Assault!.. and don't get me started on when I got my P133 mit a whopping 16 Megs of Ram and a Voodoo 1.. I was blown away by "Shadows of the Empire"..

The first "real game" I ever played was Tomb Raider, on Windows 95. I was 4 or 5 years old so I wasn't really good at it, nor did I understand a single bit of the story, but I had a ton of fun with it. Especially with the T-Rex and cheat codes

Pong

/old.
The first computer/video game I ever played was... I believe it was Genesia/Ultimate Domain (it had two names), on my crappy old win98 computer.
Crimson Skies. I was too young to play it, yes, but it was sooooo much fun.

Toy Story 2 for Windows 95. I still have the original disk and occasionally play it.

Edited January 19, 2014 by swiftgates24
I can't remember, but i'm not that old so it was probably in the late 90's.
Super Mario.
The Sims, I had no idea how to play but it was awesome.

Pong

/old.

Pong ? me too

First computer game...something on my friends Commodore at a guess...can't have been very memorable
I'm fairly young, so I'm pretty sure that my first game was Mario Kart on a DS.
Asteroids on a Sinclair ZX81.
Prince Of Persia on MS-DOS when I was 2 years old (1995), some time later I rented it for my Sega Genesis. I still haven't fully completed it.

Pong

/old.

Ha.

Hunt the Wumpus. On an ICL mainframe. Via a Teletype ASR-33 printing terminal.
I have fuzzy memories of Rollercoaster tycoon and Locomotion, but the first game I really tried to beat was Wind Waker. I still love that game

I have vague memories of this Star Wars game. I THINK it was Rebel Assault, but I remember so little I can't be certain. I was very young at the time, and I never really figured out how to play. The first games I have any significant and detailed memory of are Rollercoaster Tycoon and Microsoft Flight Simulator 98.

Jazz jackrabbit . on a PS2 (Yes the IBM PC ) not the game system .

there was on I had Before that on a tandy 80 the Trash 80 as they are called . with ECG graphics.... 5 inch drive .

BUt I cant remember its name ..
I think it was some variant of DecWar or Star Trek or something, on a mainframe back in the late 70's. XD
Snake in 1991 or so

Dungeon Magic: Sword of the Elements, NES.

Yeah, just don't even ask.

Star Wars Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy, back at the age of 5

Edited January 19, 2014 by Woopert

Jet Set Willy on the ZX Spectrum.

Back in the day when you loaded everything from tape, and waited at least five minutes for a game to load. Consider that the next time you're waiting for KSP to load.
King's Quest III on my dad's Tandy CoCo.
I can trump 5thHorseman: Pong on a black & white TV.
